title: CAPS font: Mixing upper and lower
content:
Hi peeps! I have a simple question. I'm building an only-CAPS font and I wondering how you manage your lowercase glyphs in this situations. I want the same for "A" and "a", so how do you do this? Copy-paste? What about kerning? Is there any way to "delete" those glyphs? but I need that even the user type A or a the same letter came up.

Thanks a lot!  
Mike
author: mikej

comments.content:
I just found this: [http://forum.fontlab.com/typetool/all-capital-fonts-t444.0.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20100203092025/http:/forum.fontlab.com/typetool/all-capital-fonts-t444.0.html "http://forum.fontlab.com/typetool/all-capital-fonts-t444.0.html")  
But damn! I have kerned all my uppercases!
Any ideas? how to copy kerning from glyph to glyph?

Why Fontlab wont allow me to do a class like A:A'a ? Any tips on this guys? So I want to make a kerning class for each UPPERCASE containing the equal lowercase so lowercases can work with the uppercase kerning. Am I right?

Thanks!
Edit your kerning table manually in Text Wrangler.
You mean, copy/paste special then edit kerning table?
